front.title: BlackBerry's Elliptic Curve 2y^2=x^3+x over Field Size 8^91+5

abstract.t: Multi-curve elliptic curve cryptography with curve 2y^2=x^3+x/GF(8^91+5) hedges a risk of new curve-specific attacks. This curve features: isomorphism to Miller's curve from 1985; low Kolmogorov complexity (little room for embedded weaknesses of Gordon, Young-Yung, or Teske); similarity to a Bitcoin curve; Montgomery form; complex multiplication by i (Gallant-Lambert-Vanstone); prime field; easy reduction, inversion, Legendre symbol, and square root; five 64-bit-word field arithmetic; string-as-point encoding; and 34-byte keys.

This document aims to contribute to multi-curve Elliptic Curve Cryptography by describing how to use this curve for elliptic curve Diffie--Hellman. Reports of experience and experiments with this curve are encouraged to better understand its security and utility.
This document was produced outside the IETF and is not an IETF standard. Publication of this document does not imply endorsement by the IETF of the curve described in this document.
